name: Allen Iverson
team: Philadelphia 76ers, Denver Nuggets, Detroit Pistons, Memphis Grizzlies, Philadelphia 76ers
description: He won four scoring titles and became a touchstone for a generation of fans who loved his defiance and heart as much as his crossover.

name: Dirk Nowitzki
description: A 12-time All-NBA selection, he willed the Dallas Mavericks to their lone title, upsetting LeBron James and the Miami Heat in 2011.

name: Dwyane Wade
team: Miami Heat, Chicago Bulls, Cleveland Cavaliers
description: His first of three titles came in 2006, when Wade brought the Heat back from a 2-0 deficit and was named Finals MVP.

name: Jason Kidd
team: Dallas Mavericks, Phoenix Suns, New Jersey Nets, Dallas Mavericks, New York Knicks
description: The only player in NBA history to record more than 15,000 points, 10,000 assists and 7,000 rebounds.

name: Kevin Durant
description: Durant has established himself as one of the top three players of his generation alongside teammate Stephen Curry and LeBron James.

name: Kevin Garnett
description: With 15 All-Star selections in 21 years, four straight rebounding titles from 2004-07 and easily the most lethal sneer in league history.

name: Kobe Bryant
description: For 11 of his 20 seasons he was first-team All-NBA. The biggest knock on the Black Mamba is he was the second-best player on the Los Angeles Lakers for three of his five titles.

name: Lebron James
description: He is simply the greatest preps-to-pros player, edging out Kobe Bryant, Kevin Garnett and Moses Malone.

name: Paul Pierce
team: Boston Celtics, Brooklyn Nets, Washington Wizards, Los Angeles Clippers
description: He actually played two more seasons in Boston (15) than Larry Bird did

name: Reggie Miller
description: Beyond the 3-point bomb he shot with aplomb, Miller’s greatest trait was his ability to crawl beneath an opponent’s skin.

name: Ray Allen
team: Milwaukee Bucks, Seattle SuperSonics, Boston Celtics, Miami Heat
description: He broke Reggie Miller’s all-time 3-point record in Boston (with 2,973 for his career, Stephen Curry is still more than 1,000 behind).

name: Stephen Curry
description: He’s won a scoring title, two MVPs and two NBA championships — and he’s just 29.

name: Steve Nash
team: Phoenix Suns, Dallas Mavericks, Phoenix Suns, Los Angeles Lakers
description: A two-time MVP, he led the NBA in assists five times and for four seasons joined the exclusive 90-50-40 Club.

name: Tim Duncan
description: A five-time NBA champ, two-time MVP and three-time Finals MVP, he was the only player to be selected to both the All-NBA and All-Defensive teams in each of his first 13 seasons.
